sections.PURPOSE: of this Qualification is to qualify Kronos Troop Primary and Alternate Gunners for the M240 and M249.
sections.KEY TASKS:
Identify Safeties and Trainers
Conduct Mounted MVT to the Range
Range Set up
Overnight Memo
sections.END STATE:
All Kronos Troop Primary and Alternate M240 and M249 Gunners are qualified on their weapon systems.
Training Objectives:
Each 240 Gun Team has their Gunner and AG Qualified on their Weapons System (14 240 Gunners in Total)
Each 249 in Troop has a Qualified Primary and Alternate Gunner (36 249 Gunners in Total)
Resourcing
CLI: A-A-A Rations Cycle
CLIII: 6 liters CLP
CLIV: N/A
CLV: Requested CLVIII: K31, with CPL Stovall as Medic Misc: 2x 10lb Fire extinguishers, C-Wire, Pallets, and Tarps for Ammo Point, 300 Paper Targets for Zero
240 TC: TC 3-22.240
249 TC: TC 3-22.249
Back Side Support
OIC: 1L:T Wuerthner
RSO: SSG Voss
Safeties: SSG Carrasco, SGT Barker, SGT Cox, SSG Mitchell Instructors if needed provided by Section 1x NCO for Ammo Point (SGT Montalvo)
2x PAXs for Gate Guard
2x PAXs for Overnight Ammo Guard
sections.MISSION:
K TRP, 3/2CR conducts M240 and M249 Qualification for all Kronos Troop 240 and 249 Gunners at RNG 112 on 13-14MAR 2024. This qualification will provide Kronos Troop with a Qualified Primary and Alternate gunner for each 240 and 249 Weapons System.
LOA DOG
RANGE 202A

values: Convoy Leaders will give ramp brief prior to movement. Vehicle Crews will wear all required PPE while operating tactical vehicles. Vehicles will follow range roads and use ground guides in parking areas.
Ramp Brief, Rollover and other Drills, Proper PPE, Ground Guides, Follow Roads
Vehicle Crews, Convoy Leaders, PLT Leadership

Vehicle Crews will place snow chains on their vehicles if road conditions deteriorate. Additionally, Vehicle Crews will drive at reduced speed limits to and from the Range. These actions will be conducted on order from Convoy Leaders.
Convoy Leaders will review weather data and make decisions based on the ground conditions.
Convoy Leaders, Vehicle Crews, Training Leadership

PMI for the M240 and M249 will be conducted with all shooters the week prior to the execution of the range. Platoons will send instructors with inexperienced shooters to the range to ensure soldiers properly use the weapon systems.
PMI conducted for M240 and M249, Instructors accompany soldiers as needed
SSG Voss for PMI, PLT and Squad Leadership
Brief procedures for malfunction/ misfire, conduct proper PMI and concurrent training
Ensure weapons and ammo are clean before use.
Safety Brief, Proper PMI training, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs
Safeties check for hearing protection, to ensure Troopers have standard issue protection or they will be provided hearing protection prior to firing weapon.
PCCs/PCIs, Extra Hearing Protection available at range, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs
Firers will wear approved ballistic eyewear while at the range to prevent expelled brass, dirt, dust, and debris from damaging their eyes
PCIs, Lane Safeties, Safety Validation exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs
Ammo will not be placed on the ground, Provide adequate guards for ammo while range is not occupied.
All ammo handling procedures will be followed for transport, storage, and distribution.
Range Safety Brief, PCC/PCI
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs
Brief range limits and cease fire procedures movement downrange will be controlled by the range safeties
Safety brief, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs
Proper uniform: Full Dragoon Standard for Qualification.
Thorough safety briefing for both firers and range safeties.
Qualified combat life Saver/ medic will know MEDEVAC procedures.
PCIs will be conducted prior to entering range. Range safeties will be on lanes.
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs on lane safety.

subtasks.hazard: 8. Mishandling of Weapons on Firing Line

values: Follow procedures when loading, firing, and unloading weapons.
Remind Soldiers to consider weapons loaded at all times and to check chambers often.
Safety Brief.
Safety Brief, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs
Range will cease fire with severe weather. Range OIC will contact GTA range operations desk if the weather is called into question.
Safety Brief, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/ RSO, SMs
Range will cease fire when wildlife is on the range. SMs will be instructed not to interact with wildlife.
Safety Brief, Safety Validation Exercise
Leaders, Range OIC/RSO, SMs
